head.title: Norwalk La Mirada Unified School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: The Norwalk-La Mirada Unified School District is located in Norwalk, CA and includes 29 schools that serve 17,300 students in grades Pre-KG through 12.

h1.a: Norwalk La Mirada Unified School District

li.a: School Bond Initiative - Measure G and S

div.marquee: Please note that all schools and programs are closed from March 14, 2020 through June 2, 2020.

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 1400px; height: 622px;

svg.metadata: Created by potrace 1.10, written by Peter Selinger 2001-2011

div.div: The NLMUSD is committed to the children and families in our community. Over the last two weeks, we continued to provide meals daily during the school closure. We will continue to provide food as we move forward. In our efforts to protect our valued employees and implement “Safer at Home” practices, we will be changing the format of our Nutrition Services program as follows. Unfortunately, to prepare for this new distribution, there will be no food pick-ups this coming Monday, March 30th or Tuesday, March 31st. Click on the news posting for more information.

img.alt: Schools and District Offices Closed Featured Photo

div.div:
***NLMUSD SCHOOLS & DISTRICT OFFICE CLOSED TO PUBLIC***
In light of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and as a precautionary measure, all Norwalk-La Mirada Unified Schools and the District Office will be closed to the public through June 2, 2020 . If you have a question, please email or call the appropriate school or District Department.
For general inquiries, please call 562-210-2000. If you have an emergency, please call our School Safety Department at: 562-929-1677
Please visit www.nlmusd.org for school contact information, District departments, and updates.

The Norwalk- La Mirada Unified School District considers the health and safety of our students a top priority. Many students, faculty, families, and staff are concerned about the current outbreak of the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV). Please click here for information, resources, and precautions regarding the Coronavirus.
Location: El Camino High School, 14625 Keese Dr, Whittier, CA 90604, USA

li.a: Public Notice for Seeking 21st Century Community Learning Centers

div.aside: Norwalk La Mirada Unified School District

div.a:
Uniform Complaint Procedures
and Sexual Harassment Policy

div.p: The Board of Education of the Norwalk-La Mirada Unified School District is committed to equal opportunity for all individuals in education. The Norwalk-La Mirada Unified School District prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived age, ancestry, ethnicity, parental status, pregnancy status, color, mental or physical disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical information, nationality, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or association with a person or a group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. This applies to all acts related to school activity or school attendance within a school under the jurisdiction of the Superintendent of the District. School and District personnel will take immediate steps to intervene when it is safe to do so and when he or she witnesses an act of discrimination, harassment, sexual harassment, intimidation, or bullying.
The Governing Board designated the following person(s) as the Title IX Coordinator/Nondiscrimination Compliance Officer:

Title IX Coordinator/Compliance Officer
Michael R. Gotto, Ed.D.
Director, Human Resources
12820 Pioneer Blvd. Norwalk, CA 90650
(562) 210-2132

div.aside: Every Student. Future Ready. Our Promise!
